variants.Description in input context: A53T mutation (p.A53T) associated with Parkinson's disease

Material used.Description: Experiments used recombinant alpha-synuclein proteins (A53T mutant and wild-type) in in vitro aggregation assays.

Readout description.Result Description: The A53T variant exhibited increased aggregation propensity and enhanced toxicity in cell cultures compared to wild-type alpha-synuclein.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were repeated three times with independent protein preparations.

Technical replicates.Description: Each sample was analyzed in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type alpha-synuclein was used as a positive control for normal aggregation behavior.

Basic negative control.Description: No protein (buffer only) was used as a negative control for aggregation.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used to compare aggregation levels between wild-type and mutant variants.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Aggregation levels below 20% of mutant variant levels

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Aggregation levels exceeding 50% of mutant variant levels

Material used.Description: Toxicity was assessed in SH-SY5Y cells expressing wild-type or A53T mutant alpha-synuclein.

Readout description.Result Description: Cells expressing the A53T variant showed significantly higher toxicity (measured by cell viability < 60%) compared to wild-type (cell viability > 85%).

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent cell culture experiments were performed.

Technical replicates.Description: Each experiment was repeated in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type alpha-synuclein-expressing cells were used as a positive control for normal viability.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected cells were used as a negative control for toxicity.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test was used to compare toxicity between wild-type and mutant variants.
